description:
For the first time in Belgium, a meet up of growth hackers. 

We'll have Peter Symons, the biggest growth hacker in Belgium will take us on a ride by sharing his unique experience of growth hacking Twoo! How cool is that?

Agenda

1. Introduction to Growth Hacking - presentation of 50 min

2. Hands-on experience from Peter Symons, the biggest growth hacker in Belgium - 30 min


3. Sharing peer-to-peer experience from audience
name: Growth Hacking Belgium #0: Kickoff

description:
Following the initial success and consequently the lack of seats and the unfortunately long waiting list of attendees we decided to replicate the kick-off meetup. The first additional Belgian city is Antwerp, courtesy of our host IdeaLabs.

To be clear: we will present the very same introduction as the first time in Brussels. So if you have been one of the lucky attendees on the first meetup there is no need attending again.

For new members: this meetup is an introduction into Growth Hacking. We will also have a guest speaker: a Growth Hacker who will share his/her experience of hyper-growth.  

You can watch the video of the first meetup to give you a taste of what to expect: http://youtu.be/DOa6HtoLW0Q

See you in the creative city of Antwerp :-)

Omar
@omohout
name: Growth Hacking Antwerp #0: Kickoff

description:
Another day another city...

Trying to cater to all tech entrepreneurs and companies we are growth hacking our way through Belgium. The 3rd city to join the Growth Hacking Belgium network is Ghent, courtesy of our host Parkoffice.

For the "veterans": we will present the very same introduction as the first time in Brussels. 

For new members: this meetup is an introduction into Growth Hacking.

Growth Hacking? The art of growing your software or web service company with little or no marketing budget. In essence it's an extremely leveraged go-to-market strategy using insights from marketing, software engineering, behavioral sciences and data analysis creating momentum and viral growth.


You can watch the video of the first meetup to give you a taste of what to expect: http://youtu.be/DOa6HtoLW0Q


You know the drill: 65 seats on a first come first served basis. 

See you in the hipster city of Ghent :-)


Omar
@omohout
name: Growth Hacking Ghent #0: Kickoff

description:
After the kick-off event of November 20th, where an overview of the Growth Hacking field was given, it's now time to zoom into some strategies and tactics that can help you grow your startup.

The first topic we'll zoom into are Landing Pages.  A landing page is what helps you convert your anonymous visitors into concrete leads and sales.  If you're unable to craft a landing page that converts traffic you can acquire all the traffic you want, you won't be able to turn it into business.

Our guest Growth Hacker this time is noone less than Jean Derely of Woorank, who will come and share his experiences with you.  More on this will follow later. 

Agenda:

- Vladimir Blagojevic: 8 Must-Have Elements of an Effective  Landing Page
- Jean Derely (Woorank): Experiences in testing Woorank's landing pages and driving traffic to them
- Thomas Cleenewerck: How to get a customized app developed for free (and make the developer smile!)

PS: If Brussels is too far from where you live, there's good news!  We will repeat the events in Flanders.  Have a look at the other meetups.

venue.name: Impulse Brussels (Tour & Taxis) - Free parking!
venue.address_1: Avenue du Port 86C, B211- 1000 Brussels, Brussels

name: Growth Hacking Brussels #1: Crafting Landing Pages that Convert

name: Growth Hacking Nivelles #0: Kickoff

description:
Another Belgian city is joining the Growth Hacking Belgium community: Leuven!

This meetup is part of a broader initiative to get the startup scene in Leuven on the map. The grassroots movement is powered by Leen + Peter + Koen from Zenjoy and An Tanghe from Bryo. Let's support them in creating a vibrant tech community in Leuven.

For new members: this meetup is an introduction into Growth Hacking.
Growth Hacking? read all about it here: http://goo.gl/SyGvdC

You can watch the video of the first meetup to give you a taste of what to expect: http://youtu.be/DOa6HtoLW0Q


See you in student city Leuven :-)

Omar 
@omohout

_____

Leuven startups?
Let’s connect the dots and see what happens.

As mentioned, this growth hacking event is the kick-off of Leuven Startups. If you are passionate about building a scalable business, if you love the web and al its possibilities, if you like to meet creative people from your own neighborhood:  You’ll probably want to engage in this open and inspiring community. Sharing, learning, having a good time and making innovative stuff happen together, that’s what it’s all about.
______

Program

18u30 - Welcome

19u00 - Plenary

Introduction - Jo Martens (nascom.be)

Leuven & Tech Startups - Mayor Louis Tobback

Growth Hacking - Omar Mohout (Sirris), Thomas Cleenewerck (inceptive.be), Wigoh (Wigoh.be)


About Leuven Startups

Live tweets

21u00 - Networking

____

Parking

SLUISSTRAAT
Door afbraakwerken van de oude Stella gebouwen is er momenteel geen parkeermogelijkheid in onze straat. STRATEN IN OMGEVING
Burchtstraat en Vaartkom is blauwe zonen. Parkeren toegelaten mits plaatsen van parkeerschijf (geldige duurtijd 2 uur)

PARKING VAARTKOM 
Volg vanop de invalswegen van Leuven de oranje pijltjes met de letter “V” er op om dezeparking makkelijk te vinden. Parking Vaartkom is gelegen op de hoek van de Vaartstraat en de J.P Minckelerstraat, tegenover café De Lantaarn. Neem de Vaartstraat naar rechts tot aan de Vaart en loop dan naar links. Op het einde van de Vaart vind je het de Hoorn-gebouw in de Sluisstraat.

Dit is een betalende parking voor ongeveer 150 wagens. Open 7/7, 24 u. Prijzen: 15 min gratis – 1u : €1,5. Max. 2u parkeren. Gratis parkeren op zondagen, feestdagen en 11 juli. Op de parking zelf staan twee parkeerautomaten, waar u met geldstukken of via SMS kan betalen.Vanaf deze parking is het ongeveer 4 minuten stappen tot aan de Hoorn.

PARKEERGARAGE TWEEWATERS
Deze parkeergarage is gelegen tussen de balk van beel en het hoofdkantoor van AB-Inbev in de Vaartkom, afslag richting Brouwerijplein. Als je deze parking uitloopt ga je naar links richting de vaart, aan de verkeerslichten rechtdoor om dan in de Sluisstaat links bij de Hoorn toe te komen. 

Dit is een betalende parking voor 250 wagens. Open 7/7, 24u. Prijzen: € 2,10 / uur> 9u: € 18 (dagtarief) 
Vanaf deze parking is het ongeveer 4 minuten stappen tot aan de Hoorn.

PARKEERGARAGE MINCKELER
Deze parkeergarage is gelegen in de Jan-Pieter Minckelerstraat 94 tussen de warenhuizen Aldi en Lidl. Loop tot aan het einde van de Minckelerstraat, dan rechts de Vaartstraat nemen tot aan de Vaartkom, links nemen tot aan de Hoorn. Dit is een betalende parking voor 280 wagens. 

Open 7/7, 24u. Prijzen: Tarief: 1u : €1,5 - 2u : €3 - 3u : €4,5 - 4u : €6 - 5, 6 en7u: €7. Max. dagtarief: €7, vanaf 19u tot 7u vast tarief van €3.Vanaf deze parking is het ongeveer 9 minuten stappen tot aan de Hoorn.

Our special guest: Vincent Van Quickenborne - Mayor Kortrijk

https://d1wh43egtz3cgo.cloudfront.net/promotion_images/0613/2396/original/vincentVQ.jpeg<a href="https://madmimi.com/promotions/4670846/edit#"></a>

Of course we will be able to ask him relevant questions and learn.

name: Growth Hacking Ghent #2: Using Social Media as a Growth Engine

description:
Learning is all about doing, with concrete examples and a hands-on approach. So we’re planning a more interactive and very focused workshop open for only 5 Startups.

It’s very simple: 5 Startup teams (every time the same teams) get together every month to focus on their growth and their growth only during an intensive 90 minutes session. See it as a Growth Hacking Meetup on steroids.


The goal is to accelerate the growth and scaling of startups that are in the "product/market fit" stage using a monthly iterative build-measure-learn process.

We invite the selected startups to have a peer-to-peer review of THEIR products, landing pages and growth strategy done live on stage to the benefit of all growth hackers and growth engineers.

Each team will have 5 minutes to talk about <b style="font-size : 16px">one growth (hacking) issue they are facing, and to ask <b style="font-size : 16px">one question to the rest of the teams. Then, for 12 minutes the entire group - led by Leo Exter & myself - will brainstorm possible answers to the benefit (and learning) of the audience creating an unfair advantage for all circle members.


There are two conditions to secure your seat:


1. You must have an up-and-running software or web service product that generates a minimal traffic of 20 unique visitors per day

2. You must register your project on http://westartup.eu and send an email to leo@westartup.eu and <a>omar.mohout@gmail.com</a> once you’ve done that with the link to your project allowing us to assess your application

You get an approval confirmation if you are selected to enter the circle. Once you made the payment (€ 50 per session) you're officially on board.


If you have questions -surely you should have- shoot me an email!

cheers,


Omar
name: Circle of Growth Workshop (limited to 5 Startups)

description:
Hi everybody,

This is special session for all of you that struggle with B2B sales (who's not?).

We have as a special guest, Sanjoy Bhose, a guru in using the good old telephone to get appointments with decision makers.

Sanjoy is a sales superstar. He is the best person in the telesales field I *ever* met in my professional life. Time and again he deliver topnotch sales performance in pretty much every country in Europe and the Middle-East. 


Sanjoy has a track record of 100% and guarantees that his approach and method will get you to your much needed appointment, no matter what.

Check his profile on LinkedIn with over +100 personal recommendations (!):

de.linkedin.com/in/sanjoybhose

Sanjoy is in Belgium performing premium workshops so grab this opportunity to see him in action.

This session is kindly hosted by Co.Station

Cheers,

Omar

name: Circle of Growth Workshop 3 (invite only session)

description:
Pricing will determine your market position, whether or not your customers can buy from you, and whether or not you can provide the level of service required by those customers.

The price your customers are willing to pay is the measure of the degree to which you have nailed the solution.

This session will cover the economy of pricing, 11 different methods to set pricing, multi-axis pricing, freemium, empirical rules and practical advice.

The workshop is a must for SaaS, software and web service Startups and companies

Subscribe here:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/pricing-strategies-for-startups-tickets-12179911443

Join Startups like seats.io, Moovly, Jardissimo, Mustr... etc that followed this workshop successfully.
name: Pricing Strategies for Startups

name: Circle of Growth Workshop 4 (invite only session)

description:
Hi (wannabe) Growth Hackers!

We kickoff the fall session with two great subjects:

Hooked - On the psychology of habit forming technology. 

Building an application becomes easier every day. Everyone has an idea and there are tons of SaaS-tools that make you build a MVP within the blink of an eye.

But how do you get people to use your app, like they brush their teeth? What key elements make Facebook and 2048 so irresistible? How do you seduce your first customers and get them addicted to our app? How do you use technology to create new habits making your customers life more pleasant? 

The Hooked-model of Nir Eyal is a framework to challenge your idea and your customer journey to insights from basic psychological principles about motivation and habits. 

This is presentation full of nice did-you-knows and surprising examples that challenge you to act given by psychologist Koen Dewit.

Koen is founder and Managing Partner of Zenjoy, a  tech-startup on the intersection of web- en mobile applications and behaviorial changes.


Designing Better Products
Many organisations and digital products are managed by business people and technical experts, lacking design expertise. Too often, design is an afterthought, a visual layer added on top in the end of the process. Yet some of the hottest startups like AirBNB, Dropbox and Pinterest prove that design can be so much more. 

In this presentation Thomas Joos will show how great leaders include design throughout the entire development cycle and shape meaningful impact for users and business. Thomas is partner at Little Miss Robot

This event is kindly hosted by BRYO.


See you all there!
name: Growth Hacking Antwerp #3: Hooked

description:
Now that you know everything about landing pages, let's take a deeper look into the use of social media as a traffic generation and engine for growth both for B2C & B2B products and services.


The session will be given by Cain Ransbottyn. Love him or hate him, when it comes to making an impact, the man is a master.

Thomas Cleenewerck will be sharing a small but powerful hack.

Looking forward to another exciting evening!  


PS: use #BeTech on Twitter to reach the Belgian tech startup community  

Keep converting!  


@omohout

The event is sponsored by VOKA Bryo, and hosted by Rent a Musician in a real castle De Bron!

name: Growth Hacking Ghent #3: Hooked

description:
While your product or service creates value and the business model captures value; it’s the cash flow that keeps Startups alive. Because cash flow is where the essential properties of a business model are determined, we will go into detail on the specific cash flow models for Startups.

In this session we will cover the financial ABC for startups. After the session you will truly understand cash flow, accountancy essentials, capital requirements, acquisition value and the (digital) balance sheet - focusing on the parts that are relevant for startups. 

The course will increase your knowledge and awareness of financial issues facing Startups and will train entrepreneurs how to evaluate a digital balance sheet. The workshop will run attendees through all of the financial aspects of a Startup business.
name: Financial ABC for startups

description:
After the kick-off event, where an overview of the Growth Hacking domain was given, it’s now time to zoom into some strategies and tactics that can help you to grow your startup.


How to craft landing pages that convert? (given by Vladimir Blagojevic)

The first topic we’ll zoom into are Landing Pages. A landing page is what helps you convert your anonymous visitors into concrete leads and sales. If you’re unable to craft a landing page that converts traffic you can acquire all the traffic you want, you won’t be able to turn it into business.

How to technically create your traffic-driven landing page? (given by Charlotte Norlund-Matthiessen &  Anne Collet)

As a fierce European, Charlotte started off in the Eurobubble with experiences from the European Parliament and the European Commission. She soon turned to entrepreneurship and co-founded ClicknSign in Paris, a platform where European citizens can make their own laws. In Paris, she also learned to code with Le Wagon and is now helping the launch of Le Wagon in Brussels. She loves to share enthusiasm about a digital and entrepreneurial Europe!


After almost 10 years as a knowledge and information manager, Anne went back to university to follow a degree in information and communication technologies. She now develops web apps as a </a>freelancer, is an active member of Rails Girls Brussels and Coach at Le Wagon coding school for entrepreneurs in Brussels. She loves helping others to overcome the sometimes frustrating learning process and seeing the bright light in their eyes when the magic of coding gets unveiled!

How to get traffic from Twitter? (given by Nicolas Finet)

<a href="http://www.cafenumerique.org/liege/wp-content/uploads/sites/14/2014/08/nicolasfinet.jpg">Nicolas is a web marketer with a solid technical knowledge and co-Founder at Sortlist. He is focused on growth, deploying talent and efforts to make it always faster. He stimulates Sortlist’s strategy in line with the strong market and business insights he possesses.

The meetup is kindly hosted by Leansquare

If you want to share your own growth hacking experience, feel free to email me! Looking forward to another exciting evening!

Keep converting!
name: Growth Hacking Liège #1 - Landing Pages

description:
After the kick-off event, where an overview of the Growth Hacking domain was given, it's now time to zoom into some strategies and tactics that can help you to grow your startup.

Landing Pages  
The first topic we'll zoom into are Landing Pages. A landing page is what helps you convert your anonymous visitors into concrete leads and sales. If you're unable to craft a landing page that converts traffic you can acquire all the traffic you want, you won't be able to turn it into business.

The session is given by expert Vladimir Blagojevic from Growth Turbine


The meetup is kindly hosted by Mobile Vikings and Corda Campus


If you want to share your own growth hacking experience, feel free to email me! 

Looking forward to another exciting evening!

Omar

venue.name: CCIB - Centre Convencions Internacional de Barcelona

name: Strata Conference Barcelona

description:
First time ever in Belgium: a gathering of Belgian Startup Weekend alumnus (participants, facilitators and organizers)!

• Have you attended or organized a Startup Weekend? • Have you heard about Startup Weekend and are curious to find out more? 

• Are you active in the Belgian startup ecosystem, or are looking to get active?

• Would you like to network with the entrepreneurs and community organizers in Belgium?

• Do you want to meet the partners, sponsors and supporters active in the Belgian startup scene?

• Are you excited to get involved or observe as the Belgian Startup Weekenders hack on the evolution of the Belgian entrepreneurial ecosystem? 

If your answer to any of these is even a 'may be,' you gotta be part of the first ever Belgian SW Summit!

**NO TALK, ALL ACTION**

Get in here!

This is a Belgian Startup Weekender re-union, an Xmas gathering and a hackathon on the evolution of the Belgian ecosystem - what can be the next steps to take Belgium forward and what projects can we initiate/create?

Here's the agenda flow: 

09h30 - 10h00: Welcome croissant and registration
10h00 - 11h30: Opening Ceremony
11h30 - 12h15: Pitches (120')
12h15 - 12h45: Idea selection (top 10) and team formation
12h45 - 13h30: Networking lunch
13h30 - 18h00: Growth Hacking time!
18h00 - 20h00: Closing Ceremony
20h00 - 22h00: Dinner & Drinks

We start with the opening ceremony at 10h00: the importance of Startup Weekend as a catalyzer for the ecosystem, the beginnings of SW in Belgium, SW success stories and SW Organizer stories. An overall picture on the Belgian startup ecosystem, with its current opportunities and challenges will also be presented.

The objective is to get inspired about the potential for evolution in the BE ecosystem and excited to step up and create projects!

Then we'll get in to pitching ideas (120 seconds/pitch) on potential events/projects to implement in 2015. We’ll make teams around the top 10 ideas (by open voting) and hack for the afternoon - SW style ;-)

The results will be presented in the closing ceremony. There will be no jury panel or winners in this format. The purpose is for the project teams to showcase their work, get all the support they need from the experts, community leaders, sponsors and partners present, and hit these projects off in the next days/weeks!

Along with the above flow, You will be able to: 

- Network and meet alumni from other SWs as well 
- Talk with and learn from organizers 
- Get more info about the all program of Up Global, Startup Digest, SW Next, Startup Weekend Vertical, Startup Weekend Education 

There will be pop-up workshops during the afternoon on: 

- Lean Startup principles
- Learn how to organize a SW event (first steps, spoc, peer-to-peer sharing with organizers)
- Marketing for startups
- Subsidies and tax benefits available for startups in Belgium
- Team dynamics and founders agreement
- Top legal pitfalls for startups, and how to avoid them
- Identify the actions to be taken in the 3 regions of Belgium with local actors to support entrepreneurs and create synergies

Past SW sponsors, partners and supporters have also been invited.


Past SW sponsors, partners and supporters have also been invited.

This is the first step for organizing a SW Organizers summit next year, inviting organizers from France, Germany, Netherlands and Belgium and hack on cross-border collaboration and evolution. If you're interested in joining that project team, get in touch with myself and the organizing team on the day. 

See you in Leuven on Sunday, December 7! 


Ali Sohail 

Lead Organizer 

Belgian SW Summit 

+32 485 340 835
name: Belgian Startup Weekend Summit
